entry.et: Italian maneggiare, from mano hand, from Latin manus

def.dt: :to handle or direct with a degree of skill: as
:to make and keep compliant can't manage their child
:to treat with care :husband managed his resources carefully
:to exercise executive, administrative, and supervisory direction of manage a business manage a bond issue manage a baseball team
:to work upon or try to alter for a purpose manage the press manage stress
:to succeed in accomplishing :contrive managed to escape from prison
:to direct the professional career of an agency that manages entertainers
:to direct or carry on business or affairs

entry.et: Italian maneggio management, training of a horse, from maneggiare

def.dt: :the action and paces of a trained riding horse
:the schooling or handling of a horse
:to arrange or exhibit so as to achieve a desired effect
:to arrange or direct from behind the scenes
